Summary: This place is trash. When we arrived the bathroom door knob was broken and my husband and nephew got locked inside. Security had to kick door in to fix doorknob. Door still not fully close after. Very disappointed and had to pay a $100.00 deposit at the beginning of our stay. Staff did not speak English very well. Wi-Fi was spotty. Beds were very uncomfortable. Do not book a room here ever. Very disappointed for how I was charged.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and for choosing to stay at our hotel. We apologize your stay was less than perfect. Your experience is not representative of our usual performance. We would like to regain your trust and hope to serve you again in the future.

Summary: We are a family and booked this location because it offered free breakfast.  They no longer serve breakfast so it's false advertisement. They said because of covid they stopped,  yet everything is open again.  This was the reason we picked this location.  They need to remove that from their website along with the jacuzzi since it's cold. Also,  lots of sketchy people walking and hanging around the parking lot.  Rooms are good for a motel
Manager Response: Thank you for your review-we apologize for the miss-communication regarding breakfast. We hope to welcome you back in the future for a better experience.

Summary: Booked a night here because it was close to knotts berry farm.  Huge mistake.  I booked on hotels.com, so room was paid for. I show up and they demand a cash deposit - never seen this before. I go to the room, and see cockroaches all over.  Some smashed to the floor, so they've been walked over.  Walls were dirty too, but who cares - i wasn't staying in this disgusting place. I walked back to the office and told them it was disgusting and i was leaving.  The lady said it was nonrefundable.  I told her i would do a charge back on my credit card.  I am also reporting to the health department.  Don't think about staying in this dump!
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and for choosing to stay at our hotel. We apologize your stay was less than perfect. Your experience is not representative of our usual performance We would like to regain your trust and hope to serve you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Wouldn't allow my worst enemy to stay here!
Summary: As a general rule I try to find positive things to add to a review. I couldn't find anything positive to say about this place. Very unsafe feeling No parking. All parking spots were filled. Had to wait over an hour until someone left. Checked in late. Hotel clerk was barely awake and didn't speak much English.  Bed was thin and hard. Not comfortable. TV did not work. No wifi
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest. We apologize for the parking issue you experienced, along with the amenities in your room. Appropriate action has been taken to ensure this is not repeated. We hope you will visit us again soon.

Summary: This is my 3rd time staying here, I love the Colony Inn. Great location close to Knotts Berry Farm. It is a budget hotel no frills. Rate includes a Continental Breakfast. The room is always clean.  One of my rules of travel is know where you are staying, This isn't the Ritz so don't expect a bellman. 24 hour housekeeping or full breakfast. It is a clean room with a tv good service and a carb fest. Walk next door to the gas station and buy good coffee  or wait until you get to knotts and get a starbucks.
Manager Response: It is a pleasure to read your fantastic review of the Colony Inn. We are thrilled that you enjoyed our your stay as well as our convenient location. Thank you for your support and we look forward to your next visit with us.

Summary: The room is Okay  Wanted to check in early ,should have ask &  I would have paid thats was bad on my part but also wasn't inform  its outdated but it was clean, Breakfast not the greatest but okay , but I felt the location  to Knotts was good
Manager Response: Thank you for making the Colony Inn a part of your travel plans. We apologize that you we're unhappy with your stay and you felt our facility is outdated, but clean and our breakfast offerings were okay. We appreciate you highlighting our location and we look forward to your next visit next time your in our area.

Summary: The staff was friendly and attentative to your needs. You get what you paid for. Got it for knotts berry farm. You literally walk across the street and you're there. Overall, the hotel was clean and provided what we needed for the short two days.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Colony Inn and sharing your great experience. We are happy you were impressed with all our service and facilities. It was a pleasure having you as our guest, and we look forward to hosting you again soon.

Summary: I have to say my experience was quite nice.  I stayed in room 203, and it smelled just fine.  I find most motels can't keep the cigarette smoke out but this room was very nice.  Beds were comfortable.  Outside noise was not noticeable.  I slept through breakfast, but the coffee was fine.  The staff was friendly, the internet worked.  I did have to park several rooms away when I came back late, but was able to move my car closer the following morning to load it up.  Also, when I arrived before 9a to drop off bags before check-in, they said they has a room available and I could move in early.
Room tip: 203 smelled good, was close to the office, and not far from breakfast.
Manager Response: We appreciate your recommendations! Thank you for your valued business and we look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: This place is a dump.  I am so sorry I exposed my children to this place.  The rooms are shabby, beds are thin and worn, very uncomfortable, telephone to call front desk didn't work, the tv in the bedroom was an old tv bad picture and remote didn't work.  The breakfast is horrible, the coffee is simply yucky!  The water went cold the second morning, I let the front desk know, front desk person came in to check the water, turned on the water for a while and said it was not.  It wasn't I ran after him and he told me its hot.  The third morning the water is still cold, went back to the front desk, they said maintenance will look at it.  Was told water heater was unplugged, WHAT?  anyway had cold showers for the rest of the week.   Parking was also an issue, looks like people gather
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving your feedback in regards to your stay at the Colony Inn Buena Park, Ca. It is disheartening to read that we did not live up to our usual standards, and we are truly sorry your stay was less than satisfactory. We are taking appropriate steps to ensure future guests do not encounter the same issues. We hope you will accept our apologies and consider giving us another chance to show you the outstanding service that we typically provide.

Summary: This motel was close to Knotts Berry Farm but terrible. The room was filthy and the couch was full of dirt. Don't go. They claim a breakfast but nothing worth eating. STAY AWAY!!!! Not with the price. Find another one close by.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review. If your not satisfied with your room please request another one. We are more than happy to accommodate you with a different room. Thank you for your business.

Summary: I was meeting friends at Knott’s Berry Farm and the motel is right across the street, and has a Walgreens and restaurants close to it, which was convenient.  The room smelled of cigarette smoke and it didn’t feel too safe when I opened the window as it backed onto a residential area.  Used the laundry which was fine (two washers, one dryer) but take quarters as the front desk had none and I had to walk to Walgreens to get change. Free breakfast was ok - toast, muffins and cereal.
Manager Response: Thank you Rob for being our recent guest at the Colony Inn Buena Park, Ca. We appreciate your comments and we're glad our location was good for your plans. We have made notes and will be taking care of the smell of smoke you experienced in your room. Please accept our apology. We hope that you will be returning again in the future on your next visit to Buena Park.

Summary: this motel was super dirty and old. Super expensive for what you get. The ” continental breakfast ” was a joke. It was just simply old tiny muffins. Front desk attended was super rude. I just simply had a bad experience.
Manager Response: Adriana E, thank you for making the Colony Inn a part of your travel plans. Please accept our apology for your unpleasant stay. I have noted your comments and will be taking appropriate action to prevent these issues for our future guest. Thank you for your business.

Summary: I stayed here for 11 days in March, the hotel is within walking distance to Knotts berry farm, there's plenty of car parking space, with a reasonable sized pool area. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are your basic 2 star rooms, with a fridge microwave and coffee making facilities, the TV has limited channels. There's free WiFi and a free continental breakfast. Overall its what you'd expect from a 2 star hotel
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience at The Colony Inn, Buena Park, Ca. We take pride in our customer service and hospitality and we want every stay to be a pleasant one. Thank you for your business and please come back again on your next visit to Buena Park Ca.

Summary: I like this place! big room s, nice front decks and clean place. And the maids are helpful ..great for couples and family's and they have free breakfast and coffee all day long.refrigerator and microwave in your room.

This motel is a nice place to stay if your going to Knotts Berry Farm or in my case Knotts Scary Farm. There was a really nice front desk person, the only thing I found wrong in my room was the walls were a little dirty and there were dirt marks on the door jam in the bathroom, when I told the front desk person he stated he could move me to another room and he would check into how the room was cleaned and would let the owners know how the room was taken care of and the problem would be taken care of. The property was very clean and it has a pool if you go in the summer. There is a Walgreens right next door if you forgot something at home.

The price was good, but that's the few positive things about this place. The bathtub had ants. The faucet was leaking. The safety latch was broken. The curtains covered the AC unit so we had to use shoes to hold the curtains. The location appeared safe. It's a bit run down. The room was big. The breakfast was limited. Their was no decaffeinated coffee. Another positive is it is right next to Knott's Berry Farm. I did tell the front desk about the ants and leaky faucet. I doubt we will return.

lumps in mattress, paint peeling on door, visible filth on baseboard and corner, splatters on walls, gouged toilet seat, no iron, expect you to plunge plugged toilet, breakfast is cold cereal and toast with thick syrup for juice. well worth to stay anywhere else. The man who checked us in was nice, the man on Wednesday morning was a rude jerk. The only positive about this place is free parking. DO NOT ruin your vacation by staying here. You will hardly sleep.

We stayed in the family suite and it was clean.  A few minor repairs needed like the toilet seat was cracked and one of the dresser drawers was broken.  They didn't really offer a breakfast except I believe juice and toast.  There might have been more but I got there a little late.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Location is wonderful it's directly across the street and a five minute walk to the Knotts Market Place.

In my opinion this motel is not the best. The only thing it has going for it is it is right across the street from Knottsberry farm. When we first arrived the room that we were in the air conditioning did not work and it was quite warm. So they moved us to another room. In the second room a couple of lightbulbs are out and the faucet in the sink did not work correctly. In fact it hardly worked at all. They have a continental breakfast however when we went down for the breakfast at 8:50 we were told that it was closed for the day. In my opinion these rooms are quite expensive for what you get. The rooms are very outdated. They're OK but they could be a little bit cleaner.

Summary Heading: Nasty hotel next to Knotts Berry Farm
Summary: The floors in this place were very dirty, blood drops, dead bugs on the bathroom  floors. There was a roll of toilet paper on the tank of the toilet with poop on it and there was poop on the outside of the toilet bowl. The fan in the bed room was so out of balance it was to scary to use. Also in the bed room there was dust  /cob webs more than a foot long. while watching tv in bed you have to move every three minutes or the lights turn off  they are on motion sensor. The mounting plates were on the wall for a iron and a vanity mirror but both were missing. The sink faucet would not shut off. For breakfast there was rotten cheese and blueberry muffins.  ONLY possitive Free parking and right across from Knotts Berry Farm.

The beds were clean and the tub was clean . The walls and floor were dirty . It's close to knotts . The A/C worked . The pool is not heated . There is no hot tub , they said it's a kiddie pool . They added a pitcher of water to the milk , in the breakfast room . They have wifi but the passcode doesn't work . The police department showed up banging on our door at 11 pm because someone called in and said they heard someone screaming , help me , from our room . It wasn't us. There isn't enough hot water for everyone to shower . It's a cheap hotel , I won't go back again .

Summary Heading: They Save Me! Great Service and Rooms!
Summary: After Days Inn cancelled my reservation with lies saying they left me a message which was a lie, I found myself on Holiday wkend with no room at 1230a!!  Down the street I found COLONY INN. The were so friendly, Mike was at the desk, went the extra mile to  get me a room, confirmed by walking to it to check if there was a fridge and microwave also. I spent 4 days there and it was fine! Large rooms, large bathroom ,terrific TV with alot of Channels and internet wwith a speed of 150mbs complimentary. Parking was easy at the door and at night even with a holiday and kids, it was quiet!!  I give them Kudos and will be back again.  P.S. I had my dog and she like the bushes and mini garden by our door. She never barked as it was so quiete, very well built! Oh it is right in front on

Although the location is ideal for Knotts and the room was inexpensive, there were far too many negatives. The room was not very clean or well maintained. There were stains on the carpet and furniture, grubby curtains, and a stale, "used" smell. The bedding was old and one pillow stank of sweat and old hair products. A leg fell off the coffee table when I moved it. There were no washcloths, the toilet roll holders were broken, the ironing board had no iron and the bath had no plug. The TV channel listing did not match what was on the TV. The bathroom fan sounded like an aircraft taking off. The lights were on timers and they switched on and off unpredictably. Breakfast was something you only try once.   I found myself wishing for the basic cleanliness of a Motel 6.   If you are

I did not encounter any mold at all.  I would only recommend this property for going to KNotts. You can walk right across the street to it in about 10 minutes. Save money on the parking fee. It's a very basic motel, I had no problems with the room except with AC which took a while to get cool.  Plenty of places to eat on Beach Blvd. For nights that the park is open late , keep in mind you may hear screams from the riders on the wooden coaster nearby.

Do not stay here! There was mold in the bathtub,mold under the sink and mold in the coffee pot! The manager refused to do anything to help us! I'm definitely calling the Health Department! The manager was also very rude!

We arrived after 11pm after a long drive and checked-in to this room. We were not comfortable staying here after seeing the condition of the room. If this is what we could see, if disturbed us on what we were not able to see. The manager was not on-site, so the attendant could not do anything other than offer another room, however our confidence was already shaken. We left and attempted to find another room somewhere else last min. We ended up at the Anaheim Wyndham resort for about $25 more per night. Contacted the manager the next day and received a full refund for our reservation. He was very apologetic and understanding, and did not hesitate to refund or reservation.

Summary Heading: A former locals perspective of why The Colony Inn is always a GOOD choice.
Summary: I'm writing this review from a former 30 year locals (relocated 2 years ago) perspective of why I choose to stay at the Colony Inn.     I'm on a budget folks and if your your budget is like mine, then your trying to  keep your costs for a 1 night to a $100 a night or less.  In this price range, I always factor in the location, along  with safety and security concerns  before making a reservation anywhere I travel. As a former local of many years, I know the Socal are well.  So for all those unfamiliar with the area, trust me, Colony Inn is the best choice when considering their price and the accommodation they provide. So If your looking to get a room in this area, The Colony Inn is probably the best choice one could for a motel in the $100 or less price range.  Here's a few

The staff were wonderful and the room was fabulous, comfortable and clean.  Knott's is a short walk and I felt safe walking alone.   They were kind enough to let me leave my truck for the day after checking out early.   I would highly recommend this hotel.

Like other reviews, if you just want a place to crash and sleep then this is the choice. Literally half the price (and maybe more) of other places in the area and about a 10 minute easy walk to Knotts front gate. Beds were clean and comfortable. Definitely needs a overhaul and updating thou. Reminds me of old motel 6/super 8 type...nothing fancy that is for sure, hence the price you are paying! The bathroom area was the least attractive with repairs needing to be done. No hair dryer in room (nor iron board or coffee for that matter). Did have microwave (we didnt use) and a refrig which was nice for cold drinks. Free breakfast consisted of coffee, kid juice boxes, granola bars, pastries/muffins. Nothing special but did the trick. Staff was friendly. Overall was quiet when we

We weren't expecting much, but sometimes, you just get more than you bargain for. The room was "clean", but the beds were a little uncomfortable. The batteries were dead in the fire alarms and kept beeping all night. The hot water spikit was turned off because is ran continuously, so I guess rather than fix it, they just shut the water off. To take a shower you had to know a just where to put it to get any hot water. They had a lot of transient living there and the van seats placed throughout the property to sit on was tacky. The complimentary breakfast was a joke and my  husband got sick from the coffee. I later check and saw all the pots had mold in the water reservoirs.

Summary Heading: If I could give a negative rating I would...
Summary: My boyfriend and I were on a road trip through the states and we left a few of our nights to just "spur of the moment" motels or hotels. First of all when you search this dump is advertised as a Super 8 online and when you call to book a room the employee on the phone doesn't speak very good English, so it is hard to know how he is introducing the place. Booked the room and arrived hours later around 430-5 ish to find out this is not a Super 8 at all!! Since we didn't have any where else to go, we stayed regardless. This was the worst mistake anyone can ever make! We got our room and first noticed the door did not latch properly and there was a 1 inch gap around the whole door. The mattresses were stained, there was gym squished to the carpet, the ac unit looked like it had

If you are looking for a five star hotel then pass this one by. If you are looking for a decent bights sleep and wanting to save hundreds of dollars compared to the Knotts Hotel then this is the place. I have stayed here for many years during the Halloween Haunt Season and it dies the job just fine. Walking distance to the Park and close to all the food you could ever want. Some rooms are better than others, so check out your room and if you dont like it just ask for another one. Pretty simple.

Just returned from a stay in Buena Park at this hotel.  The location is very good.  My room was satisfactory, just had to ask for extra towels and hair dryer.  The front desk clerk was friendly and accommodating.  However, my brother's room was in absolute disrepair, had no standard supplies at all  - refuse to stay in Room 106!!  Find breakfast elsewhere.  Be prepared for outside/upstairs noise.   Wifi non-existent.

The front desk attendant, who I believe was the owner was very friendly and helpful. The hotel and pool are clean, with the most quaint little breakfast nook for a lite breakfast they include. The most attractive asset of the hotel is the location, 7 minute walk to knotts and multiple shops and restaurants all within walking distance. All and all an outstanding value for the price, we will be back.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: It was a nice place to stay for the night. The room was not bad. All we needed was a place to shower and sleep for the night. The park is right across the street and the staff was nice enough to allow me to park my car there while we went to the park. We were given a room with three beds for 6 people. The third bed was in a separate little room. It was not separated by a door or anything. So it's not private. The breakfast provided was horrible. But it did save us some money for breakfast. I would stay here again, if only needing one night stay.

Summary Heading: Good location, just a motel, nothing more
Summary: 5 min walk to Knott's Berry Farm, location is good. However motel claims free wifi, which is not the case, there is no wifi at all. they claim year round heated pool and hot tub, which is untrue, it is a cold tub and pool. Continental breakfast is very limited, dont waste your time, Ihop is just down the street. Rooms are ok, nothing special.

This has got to be the worst hotel I have ever seen.  The room was filthy; dirty carpet, dirty walls, old soap in bath tub from previous guest, moldy shower curtain and hair on towels.  This place was disgusting! Don't spend the money!

Summary Heading: A Day at Knott's Berry Farm
Summary: Don't waste your time or money here.  My wife, our daughter and her 2 children spent Saturday June 14, 2014 at Knott's.  Our grandchildren are 5 and 8.  I looked at this motel and booked the 2 bedroom, with a seating area, family suite.  From the outside the motel was clean, and very nice, but the room was terrible.  First, it was not 2 bedrooms.  It was 1 room with 2 beds, and then some kind of an add on with 1 bed.  The refrigerator and microwave were in the bathroom area.  The place was not clean.  The carpet looked dirty, and the room generally stunk.  The tile was cracked in numerous places and the walls were dirty.  There were loose cable wires running around the baseboard.  The drapes were stained and had paint on them.  The ceiling in the "EXTRA" bedroom had fallen at

Summary Heading: If you like suprises and little sleep, this is your place!!! (Colony Inn)
Summary: Just like other people who have reviewed, we got a different room than what we were told when we made the reservation.  We got to the hotel early the day we checked in and they said our room wasn't ready until about 2:00 p.m., but were told we could park in the hotel lot and go to Knotts Berry which was nice.  When we got back to the hotel, the room we requested was no longer available even though we had already pre-checked in that morning.  The guy behind the desk was telling me this is the room I wanted as the other rooms weren't as nice and he didn't want to kick anybody out of their room.  So I guess it was o.k. to kick us out?  The room was mostly clean and somewhat updated, so it didn't feel dirty.  When it was time to try to sleep, thats when the fun started.  The walls

I was told one thing when I called to make my reservation and things changed when we arrived to check in.  Be careful what they tell you.  Close to Knotts Berry Farm, but that is not a plus for us.  Just needed a clean quiet room for the night.

This hotel has all of the former appearance of a Super 8, even though it isn't one anymore.  Let me tell you about the positive first.......we stayed one night, a Friday night.  The price was reasonable, the room was clean and it was in walking distance of Knotts Berry Farm.  All day parking at Knotts Berry Farm runs about $20........and this was free parking, so that was great.  The down side is that the bedding is old and tired.  Also, the hair dryer and iron which is advertised on their website..........was gone, only the brackets remained.  The TV was dated, although effective.  We didn't utilize the AC nor the WI-FI, so no comment there.  Lastly, the continental breakfast needs some work.  They advertise:   "FREE Continental breakfast including coffee, tea, juice, milk,

Summary Heading: This Hotel is now called Colony Inn Buena Park
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Colony Inn for 2 nights in between travelling.  We found the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful.  We arrived early to check in and our room was not available so we were kindly upgraded to a larger room that was available at no extra cost.  We had a King Room which was a great size and was a good price.  The room was very clean and had basic amenities.  Breakfast was provided and was very basic.  It consisted of cereal and toast, tea/coffee/orange juice.  Very basic but all you need to start the day!  The hotel is located right across from Knotts Berry Hotel / Theme Park.  It was a 2 minute walk to the theme park and a few minutes to the Knotts Soak City.  To get to town walking it took about 20-30 minutes to walk to local restaurants.

Summary Heading: COLONY INN HOTEL BUENA PARK not super 8 anymore
Summary: The room was big, but the comforters had holes in them and the pillows were waaay over used.  The bathroom had mold, and the drapes didn't quite close all the way.  We stayed here as a last minute decision while going to Disneyland, and we stayed 3 nights.  The room was definitely sub-par, but we could handle it.  The part that was HORRIBLE was the 'continental breakfast'. Firstly, practically no food.  A few cereals, muffins, coffee...if you get there early enough.  Next to no seating, like 15 chairs and 40 people clamoring for them.  You can't take the food back to your room.  They will block your way.  One member of our party managed to sneak out with a bit of food and was chased down back to our room.  The staff were rude, and completely inept.  I would NEVER stay again.

Wow. I'm not usually at a loss for words. But I am with this hotel. It's now known as the Colony Inn of Buena Park, not the Super 8. As another reviewer mentioned, yes, this hotel has long term guests and it created the feeling of staying in a run-down apartment complex.  The room was clean enough, and although it was non-smoking, you could tell that it used to be a smoking room. The smell is just baked into the walls and bedding. It was an odd odor--old and musty. I refused to walk barefoot on the carpet and wouldn't let my son sit on the floor.  The TV remote didn't work. The AC unit sucked. While the area for the bathroom was large, it hadn't been thoroughly cleaned in a really long time. There were dirt smudges all along the bathroom door.   The lights are on a sensor and

Summary Heading: the worst customer service and noisy
Summary: not pet friendly, even thou it claims they are!! noisy, no where to park, and the customer service is horrible, cannot believe the attitude of the hotel owner Bhupal Barua (Babu) he claims he was the general manager, when i asked for a business card he gave me a card with his name on it for Super 8 Motel, ok what is the name of the hotel, Colony Inn or Super 8 Motel !! room was never cleaned..and then when it came to check out the next day, they kept calling to ask when i was leaving so they could clean, HELLO!!

An average hotel, much like anywhere else we've stayed over our month in USA.  So, 3 stars for average.  But add to that an extra star for cost (we paid $55 per night) and proximity to Knotts.  Minor issues with hand basins not draining well but of no significance.  Friendly staff, nice basic continental breakfast and large spacious room.

Initially went to Portola motel, which was a major disappointment (the room smelled of sweat and the bathroom was the worst), bailed on that and went to this motel, and it was a major upgrade in price, cleanliness, and location.... we will be back again if in the area...very happy with the decision. Our trip to Knotts was saved because of this.

Summary Heading: Walking distance to Knott's Berry Farm but old and dirty
Summary: The hotel has been renamed to Colony Inn and unfortunately the new management and name didn't put any money into it.  The rooms were poorly cleaned with a lot of lint and noticeable dust. The sheets were worn and definitely many years old.  There were no Geese harmed in the making of their tiny pillows.  Honestly, the pillows you receive on the airlines are more comfortable than these ones.  On a positive note, the gentlemen at the front desk were kind. The only reason we stayed here is because the Knott's Berry Resort was fully booked.  I rated this hotel 2 stars only because it is right across the street from Knott's Berry Farm, which is about the only thing going for it.  If you are going to spend the majority of your time out and all the other hotels within walking distance

It's a perfect stay and the manager was very helpfull. I reserved for me and my children that hotel beause is near the park Knott's berry farm. At the front desk you can reserve the tickets and pay by cash with special price and also I pay for Sea World and Universal Studio. I will come back again with a family group.

Summary Heading: It's a great place to stay for the price you pay
Summary: The Room was around $55 right across Knotts next to a Walgreens. The room was spacious with a microwave and fridge, the bed was typical, comfortable enough, Wifi and the offered a continental breakfast( toast, muffins, cereal, oj, apple juice and coffee ) I really don't have nothing bad to say about this motel except that they can use more employees for better service. I mean, if I was in the area, this would be the place for me.

Summary Heading: Pretty decent for the price you pay!!!
Summary: I saw some horrible reviews & a few good reviews about this motel before I checked in cos I needed to visit the Knott's berry farm during the memorial week end. As this motel was conveniently located minutes of walk away from the park, I took the chance with some skepticism. To my pleasant surprise the service was pretty good, the room was quite spacious with comfortable beds with many amenities at your disposal. free breakfast (Cannot grumble at all for what I paid!). All in all it was a pleasing experience. I believe the management has made an effort to improve the standards of the hotel.  I truly understand that everyone cannot be pleased. But I truly was pleased & I am so glad that I stayed. For the 69 bucks I paid, I need I ask for anything more? Hell no!!!! I 'd gladly go

Summary Heading: NEVER AGAIN!!  STAY SOME WHERE ELSE!
Summary: FYI:       Do Not Be Fooled By The So Called Great Reviews!  CONS: pubic hairs & long hairs embeded into all of the bedding, heavy stains on all bedding, walls dirty, t.v didnt work, found baby roaches in the bath room at nite, one bed had a huge indent on mattress, pillows were stained yellow, mattress stained, people living at the hotel SO Loud at nite.   PROS: close to knotts( about 5-10 min walk), free parking, managers at front desk friendly.  We are not picky people of course things are not going to be perfect, but this was beyound ridiculous. We did not check out because it was 9pm when we got to our room and our 3yr old was passed out cold after a long day at knotts, thank god we brought bedding from home in case we needed extra. That nite we complained to the manager

Summary Heading: Recommend for a place to sleep and go.
Summary: My fiance and I had stayed in this location twice. The first time we didn't want to stay anywhere expensive since we weren't going to be in the hotel the whole day.  We booked for a king bed, which also included a small refrigerator and a sofa bed. This location was walking distance to Knott's Berry Farm, which saved us parking! And the staff of the hotel was helpful and very nice. He gave us a $30 discount just because we had a conversation with him. The second time, we stayed because we were going to Disneyland. It was only 10 minutes away from the hotel. I would recommend this place only if you want to save money or in a budget. It does look like it's in a bad location, but nothing scary happened to us when we were there. The only cons about this hotel is that depending on

We stayed one night October 31st. Reserved two rooms and checked in with no problems, our rooms were right next to each other. The rooms are dated but clean and we felt very safe. Best of all was FREE PARKING and location right next to Knott's Berry Farm. Also had a microwave and mini fridge in each room.
The hotel is right across the stress from Knott's Berry Farm, so you cant beat the location. The owner is friendly and accomodating.  The room were clean, no complaints1

Went down for Knotts Berry Farm HAUNT and did not book a hotel. After looking at other overpriced hotels with not so nice rooms, stopped in at the the Super 8 to check out the rooms and prices. Staff was super friendly and gladly showed us a room, which was larger than expected. Big parking lot (had trouble parking at some other hotels later on at night due to lack of spaces), very clean, comfy beds and actually very quiet at night. Easily within walking distance to Knotts Berry Farm, so we did not have to pay the parking fees for the park. Even had a friend drive down to go with us and they let him park his car there as well, even though he was not staying. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good value or is visiting Knotts.

I stayed 3 nights with my husband and kids. We were out all day, came just to sleep. The complaints I have is that there was no coffeemaker in my room and no hot water for my tea in the breakfast room the first day. I had nice comfortable beds were I felt rested, and enjoyed the proximity of the hotel to Knotts and other attractions. The maid was fantastic, as she cleaned our room well and provided us with extra towels as requested. The kids enjoyed the swimming pool.

Summary Heading: I don't know about Super....but pretty darn close!
Summary: First off - some of these reviews seem to be of a totally different location.  I was so nervous about this place and for NO REASON!  The staff let us check in early and they even let us park there while not being checked in (we were in Knots Berry Farm).  The parking was right in front of our room...the pool was great and the rooms?  Clean, neat, everything worked and the rooms were bigger than what is usual.  There was even a fridge.  Wallgreens is right next door, so if you need water...it's right there.  Food places are around the corner--nothing to really walk to.  So, we saved $12 by NOT parking across the street at Knotts Berry Farm and slept soooo good!

Paid $60 a night, was a great price and a good clean hotel. Room was a lot bigger than than we thought it was going to be. No problems at all, area around hotel was safe and clean. No real food close but a short drive, there is lots to choose from.  Breakfast was ok, enough to get you going, coffee,cereal, toast, juice and muffins. Front desk had nice friendly employees, maids did a good job, after there yelling match at each other in the maids storage room. Would stay there again.

Summary Heading: this hotel is a great value, other reviews are simply incorrect
Summary: I stayed at this hotel more than 15 times over the past 3 years when it was part of the Choice Hotels chain. It was always one of the least expensive Choice Hotels properties in the 10-15 mile surrounding area, and I had been surprised at the value for the money. Yes, I am somewhat cheap, but I won't stay somewhere that has issues with noise, cleanliness, or service.  The most recent review I see here is for a hotel in Illinois and is obviously not about this hotel next to Knotts in California. The next most recent review mentioned old hole-punch style key cards which are not the kind of cards this hotel has been using since I've been staying there since 2005. Maybe the hotel was upgraded since these people stayed there.  I think some of these other reviews are for another hotel

My husband and I stayed there a few years ago, and it is BY FAR the worst hotel experience we'd ever had.  First of all, it's in the hood.  They don't tell you that on Expedia.  I almost ran over a bum on the way there.  We pulled up after spending a whole day at Knott's Berry and found that you have to wait OUTSIDE in the COLD to check in.  These poor families were ahead of us with all of their little kids, freezing, and the employee could not find their reservations.  Luckily (or maybe not) they finally found ours.  The key to the room?  An old-fashioned credit card-sized piece of plastic with little holes in it, which did not work.  My husband had to walk back down and 20 mins later a maintenance man finally showed up and let us in.  We get inside--no linens on the bed.

If you're planning a trip to Knotts Berry Farm this hotel is the place to stay. We had a nice room with a mini fridge and microwave. The location is great and the front counter staff very helpful and courteous. Will definitely stay here again.

We stayed at this hotel for two nights in August 2006.  The rooms were clean, average size and included a small refrigerator.  The free breakfast was your basic pastry, juice, bread and bagels.  The hotel is easy walking distance across the parking lot from Knott's Berry Park.  Save money from staying at the higher priced hotels and stay here.

The first room lights didnt work ,tv only got one channel and it smelled. The second room they put us in had no sheets,towels or toilet paper and carpet was soaking wet . Called down to front desk and they wanted us to put our own sheets on since maid was off. Finally after 2 hours of waiting the thrid room was ok had clean sheets but carpet was ssssoooooooo nasty we had to wear socks. And they were having a party in parking lot people were knockin on our door and callin all night.Next time I'll pay a lil more money to stay somwhere nice.dont stay here.

This place was just vile.  Do not be fooled by the pictures on line.  This place is not nice, not clean, not safe.  There were boarded windows, very dirty rooms, gang like activity nearby.  Do not stay here, and DO NOT bring children here.  Nothing works, staff were less than friendly or competent.  This place is disgusting.  We had one towel, 2 partially used washcloths, a toilet that had someone's urine still in it.  The room's windows were boarded and everything reeked of smoke, although it was supposed to be a non smoking room.  The complimentary breakfast was a joke.  You wouldn't want to eat anything from this place anyway, even if it was a stale pastry lying in a box. Stayed at this hotel for one night for my 16 year old's birthday. Went to Knott's across the street.  BIG, big mistake. Floor was dirty, no water pressure, AC old and falling apart, drapes dirty and would not close all the way. Could not wait to check out in the morning.....

Like most people, I let myself be fooled by ads of Expedia and made the most horrible choice ever. Once my family and I arrived, we had to wait for and hour just to check in. That's when the nightmare started. The place was a mess. NOTHING WORKED. There were stains everywhere on the carpet. Holes in the walls, no cable. We had to be moved to another room which was worst but the bathroom at least worked. I could not go anywhere else since I had made the reservation with Expedia and my credit card had already being charged. It was on a Saturday night when everyone is already booked or they want an arm and a leg for a room. I had to go to the Walgreens next door to buy a Lysol just to be able to sleep in those sheets that seemed clean but the mattress had stains.  THIS WAS THE MOST

Summary: This place was a DIVE and a half. Makes motel 6 look like the Hilton.  Upon arrival into room, there was black marker pen all over the walls, no lights worked, the tv was broken, the carpet was beyond filthy, to top it off my daughter used the restroom and when she flushed it over flowed. They brought me a plunger ( how sweet GEEEZ !!!!) end all to it all is when i sat on edge of bed in disgust and despair to find myself launched onto the floor cuz the damm bed was broken also !!!!! I wouldn't reccemond this motel to a homeless person !!!!!! PILE OF CRAP !!!!!!!!! F-

In a word......TERRIBLE! Filthy floors. I didn't want to put my 9 month old son on the floor to crawl around. Dirty sheets and mattresses.  Cracks in the walls. 2 sandpaper-like towels. Yuck yuck yuck.  Awful, disgusting, horrible. I called Expedia immediately to complain.  We went to the Fairfield Inn. Much better.

Summary Heading: Stay Far, far away from this dump!!!
Summary: I was familiar with a Colony Inn at another location, and when I found a decent rate at the Buena Park Colony Inn, thought I could expect a quality establishment. Boy, was I mistaken! On arrival, we checked into a room with several non-functional lights, no towels, holes and cracks in the walls, and a nasty-looking bathroom. The TV didn't work, and the toilet was broken, so we requested another room. The second room, while much better, still had broken lamps, plus gang graffitti scratched into the mirror, and someone's leftover 9mm ammunition on the shelf. Worst, it was a cold night and there was no heat. Add to that the other hotel resident guests that stayed up all night bumping and thumping and screaming and yelling, and I don't know what possessed me to not move out.

My boyfriend and I took a trip to Knotts Berry Farm and booked this hotel through Expedia. The first room they gave us (1st floor) had *NO* power. The 2nd room they gave us (2nd floor) SEEMED to have power, but when we got back that night we found out that it really it only had one good outlet. They were booked up completly and couldn't give us a new room. We went to a discount store and bought an extension cord. Upon getting the lights on we could see that the whole place was infested by ants. No wonder half the rooms (the whole other building of rooms and half of the wing we were in) are roped off with yellow CAUTION tape and closed. One good thing was that we could walk to Knotts Berry. If you don't mind bugs and only having a bathroom light, then maybe you are OK. The beds

We stayed at the Colony Inn on short notice, and chose it because of multiple ads in travel books and brochures. We were given a great rate for a kids' suite but when we arrived it was a disaster. Rooms were dirty, plumbing leaked, nonsmoking room reeked of smoke. The solution to the plumbing was for management to send towels to put on the floor!  I am sure we could have found a better room for the same or better price if we had had time to look around. Next time we won't assume that advertising in travel brochures, etc. automatically assures a quality facility.

I also found this hotel thru expedia. Seemed cheap enough and location was convient for Knottsberry farm. How ever after entering our room, we found it to be dirty, smelly and noisy. Right behind our room is a convience store/station and repair shop. Where we heard an air gun blasting into the late evening hours. We went down for morning coffee to find it had been there since the night before so you can imagine what it tasted like and iced cold on top that. Recomend pay a little more and stay somewhere else.

I had prepaid for a two night stay at this motel through Expedia.  Great price, I thought.  Well, as the saying goes, you get what you pay for.  I had reserved a non-smoking room with two queen size beds.  The only non-smoking room that they could put me in the first night was a room with a single king size bed that turned out to have any NO HEAT.  That night was cold so I was pretty angry.  The second night I was placed in the correct room, but then I ran into the second and more serious problem with this motel.
